author: @lordvirus21
text: Can you post a code so as to plot prices of the y axis on the right side? i tried the modification of your code as shown below but it adjust only the label, not the prices   ax1 = plt.subplot2grid((6,4), (0,0), rowspan=4, colspan=4, axisbg='#07000d')         candlestick_ohlc(ax1, newAr[-SP:],width=.6, colorup='#008000', colordown='#FF0000')          ax1.axis.tick_right()         ax1.yaxis.set_label_position("right")                           Label1 = str(MA1)+' EMA'         Label2 = str(MA2)+' EMA'                           ax1.plot(date[-SP:],Av1[-SP:],'#e1edf9',label=Label1, linewidth=1.5)         ax1.plot(date[-SP:],Av2[-SP:],'#4ee6fd',label=Label2, linewidth=1.5)                  ax1.grid(True, color='w')         ax1.xaxis.set_major_locator(mticker.MaxNLocator(10))         ax1.xaxis.set_major_formatter(mdates.DateFormatter('%d/%m/%Y'))         ax1.yaxis.label.set_color("w")         ax1.spines['bottom'].set_color("#5998ff")         ax1.spines['top'].set_color("#5998ff")         ax1.spines['left'].set_color("#5998ff")         ax1.spines['right'].set_color("#5998ff")         plt.gca().yaxis.set_major_locator(mticker.MaxNLocator(prune='upper'))         ax1.tick_params(axis='x', colors='w')         ax1.tick_params(axis='y', colors='w')

author: @ethanoppenheim6996
text: Hey Harrison,  How do you set the Quandl data to align with the yahoo API data on the x-axis?  You used [-SP:] for aligning the moving averages, but since the Quandl data is at a different level of granularity (i.e. one row for each year for annual data), simply taking the same amount of data points from each data-set is not aligning the two.  I think you said in one of your videos there was function but couldn't find you doing it.  Thanks for all the tutorials they're all awesome!
